Welcome to devourer’s documentation!¶

Contents:

This package contains a generic generator (pretty, eh?) of declarative, object-oriented API consumer representation with declarative syntax. Whew. It’s named devourer, so we will not have to repeat it ever again.

class devourer.GenericAPI(url, auth, throw_on_error=False, load_json=False)[source]¶

This is the base API representation class. You can build a concrete API by declaring methods while creating the class, ie.:

method1 = APIMethod(‘get’, ‘people/’) method2 = APIMethod(‘get’, ‘my/news/items/’)
Hooks can be overridden globally:
def prepare(self, name, **args, **kwargs):
pass
As well as for particular methods:
def prepare_method1(self, name, *args, **kwargs):
pass
def call_method1(self, name, *args, **kwargs):
pass
def finalize_method2(self, name, result, *args, **kwargs):
pass
call(name, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This function invokes the API method from the class declaration according to the name parameter along with all the hooks. :param name: name of method to call. :param args: :param kwargs: :return: Result of finalize_method call, by default content of API’s response.

finalize(name, result, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Post-request hook. By default it takes care of throw_on_error and returns response content. :param name: name of the called method. :param result: requests’ response object. :param args: :param kwargs: :return: result.content

invoke(http_method, url, params)[source]¶

This method makes a request to given API address concatenating the method path and passing along authentication data. :param http_method: http method to be used for this call. :param url: exact address to be concatenated to API address. :return: response object as in requests.

classmethod outer_call(name)[source]¶

This is a wrapper creating anonymous function invoking call with correct method name. :param name: Name of method for which call wrapper has to be created. :return: drop-in call replacement lambda.

prepare(name, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This function is a pre-request hook. It receives the exact same parameters as the API method call and the name of the method. It should return a PrepareCallArgs instance. By default it doesn’t change the args and selects ‘name’ method from the class declaration as the callable to execute. :param name: name of API method to call. :param args: :param kwargs: :return: PrepareCallArgs instance

class devourer.APIMethod(http_method, schema)[source]¶

This class represents a single method in an API. It’s able to dynamically create request URL using schema and call parameters.

params¶

List of available parameters for this method. :return: List of available parameters for this method.

schema¶

Method’s address relative to API address. :return: Method’s address relative to API address.

class devourer.APIError[source]¶

An error while querying the API.

class devourer.PrepareCallArgs(call=None, args=None, kwargs=None)[source]¶

An inner class containing properties required to fire off a request to an API. It’s not a namedtuple because it provides default values.
